repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Ceara Second Sector Wide Approach
            (SWAP) Inclusive Growth Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Ceara Second Sector Wide
            Approach (SWAP) Inclusive Growth Project for Brazil were as
            follows: overall outcome was satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was low or negligible, and both the Bank
            and the Borrower performance were satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: (1) Coordination is a challenge. The
            project's success owed much to the strong role played
            by Ceara Economic Research Institute (IPECE) in conducting
            monthly project meetings and following up as problems arose.
            Nevertheless, fifteen partners pushed the limits of what
            could be managed effectively. (2) Beware the use of outcome
            indicators that may readily escape government control. (3)
            Secondary indicators proved to be a useful innovation of the
            project to retain a focus on an important outcome metric
            when attribution fidelity was lacking. (4) Coordination
            between distinct levels of government can be particularly
            fraught. This problem underscores the importance of
            restricting indicators, so far as possible, to
            actions/activities substantially controlled by the client.
            (5) Extraordinary efforts are warranted during project
            design to reduce information asymmetries. (6) How much
            flexibility is too much? Some flexibility is warranted for
            the World Bank to approve modifications or extensions to
            meet performance targets. However, a high degree of
            flexibility risks undermining the performance incentives of
            the targets. The Bank should consider stipulating in the
            project documentation that major accommodations must be
            justified by factors fully beyond Government of Ceara control.

            (SWAP) Inclusive Growth Project

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Ceara Second Sector Wide Approach
            (SWAP) Inclusive Growth Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The higher-level objective of the Ceara
            Second Sector Wide Approach (SWAP) Inclusive Growth Project
            for Brazil is to contribute to expanding and consolidating
            the social advances and institutional modernization of the
            State of Ceara. The project will achieve this by supporting
            nine key government investment programs in five sectors,
            selected to optimize development impact. A series of
            disbursement-linked indicators are mapped to the five
            sectors-public sector management, education, health, water
            & sanitation, and business environment &
            innovation-to strengthen the incentives to achieve results.
            There are two main project components: (i) the SWAP
            component disbursing against ten pooled Eligible Expenditure
            Programs (EEP), with disbursement-linked performance
            indicators and individual EEP expenditure thresholds as
            conditions to release loan funds; and (ii) a small technical
            assistance (TA) component to support SWAP II objectives in
            the five priority sectors. The TA component will disburse
            like a traditional operation against statements of
            expenditure (SOEs).

Brazil - Ceara Second Sector Wide Approach

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Ceara Second Sector Wide Approach
            (SWAP) Inclusive Growth Project : indigenous peoples plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The higher-level objective of the Ceara
            Second Sector Wide Approach (SWAP) Inclusine Growth Project
            of Brazil is to contribute to expand and consolidate the
            social advances and institutional modernization of the State
            of Ceara. The project will achieve this by supporting nine
            key government investment programs in five sectors, selected
            to optimize development impact. A series of
            disbursement-linked indicators (14) are mapped to the five
            sectors -- public sector management, education, health,
            Water Resource Management/Water Supply and Sanitation
            (WRM/WSS), and business environment and innovation -- to
            strengthen the incentives to achieve results. Specifically,
            the project development objectives are to: 1) help the
            Government of Ceara to improve its fiscal situation; 2)
            strengthen the state's system of results-based
            management; 3) promote better service quality in education
            (particularly childhood literacy and health; 4) improve
            access to WSS, increase cost recovery in the water sector,
            and improve the efficiency of the two government autarchies
            with responsibility for water supply and management; and 5)
            reduce barriers to business investment. The potential
            safeguard impacts associated with this project are linked to
            hospital certification (hospital waste disposal) and
            investments in WSS connections. No potential large scale,
            significant and/or irreversible impacts are anticipated
            owing to the activities of the project. The works related to
            water and sanitation will be localized and site-specific.
            Some specific investments for WSS may result in
            site-specific, reversible impacts that will be mitigated.
            Involuntary resettlements, if any, associated with these
            programs will be localized. They will not interfere with
            indigenous peoples territories.

docna.cdata!:
Brazil - Ceara Second Sector Wide Approach
            (SWAP) Inclusive Growth Project : indigenous peoples plan

            Approach (SWAP) Inclusive Growth Project : indigenous
            peoples plan
